title: 2021 (No. 1 of 2021)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947) hereby makes
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Exempted
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Exempted 

Traveller) (Covid-19) (Amendment) (No. 10) Regulations 2021.

title: 2021 (No. 1 of 2021)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947) hereby makes
heading: 2. The Health Act 1947 (Exempted Traveller) (Covid-19) Regulations
text_raw:
2. The Health Act 1947 (Exempted Traveller) (Covid-19) Regulations 
2021 (S.I. No. 134 of 2021) are amended by the insertion of the following 
Regulation after Regulation 23: 

“24. For the purposes of paragraph (j) of the definition of 
“exempted traveller” in section 38B(25) of the Act of 1947, a person is 
prescribed as an exempted traveller where the person arrives in the 
State within the period beginning on the 11th day of September 2021 
and ending on the 25th day of September 2021 having been, within a 
period of 14 days prior to such arrival, in – 

(a) 

the Republic of Argentina, 

(b) 

the Plurinational State of Bolivia, 

(c) 

the Federative Republic of Brazil, 

(d) 

the Republic of Chile, 

(e) 

(f) 

the Republic of Colombia, or 

the Republic of Peru.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

25 September, 2021. 

FERGAL GOODMAN, 

A person authorised under section 15 of the Ministers and 
Secretaries Act 1924 to authenticate the seal of the 
Minister for Health. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 28th September, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [489] 3

title: 2021 (No. 1 of 2021)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947) hereby makes
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations made under Sections 5 and 38G (inserted by section 7 of the 
Health (Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 1 of 2021)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 
28 of 1947) amend the regulations set out in SI 134 of 2021 to prescribe certain 
additional persons as exempted in that regard. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [489]
